Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Hi-TECH Scholars program is providing scholarships to increase recruitment, retention, on-time graduation rates, and diversity in three science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) Associate of Applied Science (AAS) degree programs. The targeted programs are Automotive Technology (AUT), Computer Technology (CPT), and Engineering Technology (ET). The Hi-TECH Scholars program has three main objectives:
1. Award 130 scholarships over four years to financially needy and academically talented students.
2. Award 65 scholarships to underrepresented students.
3. Graduate 100 Hi-TECH scholars with an associate degree within their two-year scholarship period.

Intellectual Merit: These objectives are being accomplished by leveraging a network of existing student support services and resources and implementing new and expanded initiatives that help retain STEM students. The Placement and Transfer offices at the college provide scholars with career guidance. Recruitment initiatives target students currently enrolled in Hi-TECH programs, students at area high schools and career centers, incumbent workers or career change seekers from the community or business and industry, and students enrolled in one or more STEM developmental courses at the college. The selection process focuses on academically talented but financial needy students entering AUT, CPT or ET programs. A GPA of 3.0 or higher is required of entering secondary students or currently enrolled college students.

Broader Impact: The project is designed to increase the participation of underrepresented groups in Hi-TECH programs and increase the number of Hi-TECH graduates completing their associate degrees in two years. The comprehensive, data-driven management plan allows for broad dissemination of best practices and lessons learned. Successful strategies developed through the project serve as models in other areas of the college and for the nation.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Piedmont Technical College’s Hi-Tech Scholars Program supported a comprehensive, student-centered scholarship program offering scholarships to increase recruitment, retention, on-time graduation rates, and diversity in three target Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Associate of Applied Science Degree programs offered by the college:  Automotive Technology, Computer Technology, and Engineering Technology.

 

The major objectives of Piedmont Technical College’s Hi-Tech Scholars Program were as follows:

  • Award 65 scholarships over four years to financially needy and academically talented students in the fields of automotive technology, computer technology, and engineering technology.
  • Recruit under-represented students to the Hi-Tech Scholars Program
  • Graduate 50+ Hi-Tech scholars in the program cycle of 2 years.

Each project goal was exceeded.  One hundred seventeen (117) scholarships were awarded to financially needy and academically talented students in the stated fields over the course of the project.  Of those scholarships, fifty-four (54) were awarded to students underrepresented in their respective programs.  Eighty eight (88) students completed all requirements for the Hi-Tech Scholars Program and graduated during their program cycles or transferred to an accredited four year institution.

 

Intellectual Merit.  The Hi-Tech Scholars Program has demonstrated success in training and preparing scholars for successful careers in the automotive, computer technology, and engineering fields, with proven and innovative tools, such as the loan-to-own laptop and scan tool program; tutoring and mentoring by STEM faculty members; the development of a comprehensive female recruitment and retention plan and strategies; scholar interactive experiences; and industry and work experiences.  The average Grade Point Average (GPA) for Hi-Tech Scholars was 3.52.

 

Broader Impacts.  The Hi-Tech Scholars Program has produced 88 graduates who were prepared for immediate placement into related STEM employment or placement into a comprehensive academic curriculum at an accredited four year institution.  Scholars have served in numerous leadership roles at the college, including Presidential Ambassadors, honor society officers, distinguished student award winners, and national award and scholarship winners.  The knowledge gained in the Hi-Tech Scholars Program, coupled with the hands-on skills and resources provided by the program, has prepared the scholars to become leaders in their fields and in their communities. 

 

Graduates of the Hi-Tech Scholars Program have gone on to be successful in their respective fields, including placement at area automotive dealerships

 

Graduates of the Hi-Tech Scholars Program cited tuition assistance, the laptop/scan tool, the mentors, monthly meetings, group discussions, and tutoring as the services that helped them the most in achieving success.
